arm_group.description: Sham drape and conventional protection (wearing a lead apron and thyroid shield as well as suspension of a standard lead skirt over the X-ray source).

arm_group.arm_group_label: lead-free protective drape containing bismuth and antimony
arm_group.description: lead-free protective drape containing bismuth and antimony (RADPAD®)  hung around the fluoroscopy image intensifier to prevent scatter radiation,  and conventional protection (wearing a lead apron and thyroid shield as well as suspension of a standard lead skirt over the X-ray source).

brief_summary.textblock:
ERCP is associated with radiation exposure to the endoscopist and staff, which may be
      significant at high volume programs despite the use of lead aprons. We hypothesize that
      draping of the fluoroscopy image intensifier may significantly reduce staff radiation
      exposure and help achieve implementation of the ALARA (As Low As Reasonably Achievable)
      principle.

clinical_study.brief_title: Digestive Endoscopy Suite Radiation Controlling Protective Strategies

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All the ERCP procedures done by the same endoscopist and nurse are enrolled

          -  Patients age >19

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Fluoroscopic procedures other than ERCP were excluded.

intervention.intervention_name: lead-free protective drape containing bismuth and antimony (RADPAD®)

facility.name: Endoscopy Center, Smilow Cancer Center, Yale New Haven Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Double-blind, Randomized, Sham-controlled Trial to Evaluate the Effect of a Lead Free Drape on Scatter Radiation Exposure to Endoscopy Staff During Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography

primary_outcome.description: Comparing the use of a lead-free protective drape containing bismuth and antimony and a sterile sham protective drape, radiation dose (RD) was measured at 3 different sites (endoscopist's eye (1) and thyroid (2), and assisting nurse's thyroid (3)) with personal dosimeters placed outside of eyeglass frames and the thyroid shield. The unit of measurement is each event. The subject was subjected to radiation during 100 Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography procedures.Both groups used standard of care lead protection.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Length of Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography, average 5 minutes
